title._content: "A Sharpshooter's Last Sleep." Compare the two photos of a Confederate killed at Gettysburg. Why might the photographer Alexander Gardner and his team move the body?  (LOC)

description._content: Gardner, Alexander,, 1821-1882,, photographer. A sharpshooter's last sleep, Gettysburg, Pennsylvania 1863 July, c1866. 1 photographic print : albumen. Notes: Illus. in: Gardner's photographic sketch book of the war / Alexander Gardner. Washington, D.C. : Philp & Solomons, [c1866], v. 1, no. 40. Copyright by A. Gardner. Title from item. Photograph showing a dead soldier and his gun. Subjects: War casualties--Pennsylvania--Gettysburg--1860-1870. Gettysburg, Battle of, Gettysburg, Pa., 1863. United States--History--Civil War, 1861-1865--Casualties. Format: Book illustrations--1860-1870. Albumen prints--1860-1870. Rights Info: No known restrictions on publication. Repository: Library of Congress, Prints and Photographs Division, Washington, D.C. 20540 USA Higher resolution image is available (Persistent URL): hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/ppmsca.12561 Call Number: Illus. in E468.7 .G2, v. 1, no. 40
